div.p: The attributes and descriptons remain in place as Harnworld requires them (at least for some characters). In other words, without them, a character designed toward a specific career would be incomplete in the setting. They are also not transformed in any way. Generation of values can be used as suggested. Relationship and Loyalty for contacts are descriptive only.

Sunsigns are attributes with value 5. Modifiers in later sections are treated as combination of the corrsponding percentage, e.g. +3 = 60%. See the Skills section how this effects the overall skill level.
The attributes described are translated (linearly) into the range -15 to 15. Moraliy is dropped. Generation of values can be used as suggested.

Table results from these page are used purely in their descriptive sense. Whether they retroractively have any effect on other attributes is a choice that can be made during character creation and according to the severity or interpretation of the result that you want to portait. Piety is turned into a skill (q.v.) for each deity. For a single deity the value can be chosen or generated as suggested. All others are 0 initially.

ul.li: Level 0: NN knows that the reigion exist but cannot separate it from other convocations.
Level 5: Lip service payed to the religion and ability to separate it from other major faiths.
Level 10: The main tenants of the religion are known and followed on individual level. Sects or heresies are not considered.
Level 15: The religion is quoted often and other faiths routinely treated underhanded. Proselytizing is rarely attempted.
Level 20: At this level the adherent is actively seeking to further the tenants of the religion outside of his immediate domain. Distinction between inner-religion minutiae are important.
Level 25: Heresy is abhorred more than other religions. Support for the religion takes precendents over other interests almost always.
Level 30: The adherent is a prophet for the religion and accepts otherwise serious consequences for following details of his faith. May invent rituals and the like.

div.p: The occupations of the table on this page serve as skills and the listed "old" skills serve only as descriptive values.

Automatic skills are determined accoridng to the appropriate skill section (q.v.) and Occupation skills work as transformed for the previous page. They open as 20 for the chosen occupation. Family skills for parents in the same occupation add 2 points, while for a different occupation they add 5. (This is effectively Row-5-addition of a 0 skill level.) Optional skills are as they exist, but new skills may be "invented"; the scope is at GM discretion. Any reasoonable skill can be improved by 5 for each option point (OP) through Row-5-addition; this includes OPs gained for Veterans. Militia skills are explained elsewhere as are psionics.
Rules on these page are completely dropped currently. Generation of values can be used as suggested.

Each clerical occupation is treated as a separate occupation, with the "old" skills being used in a descriptive sense. The same is true for the Shek-Pvar. Chantry Applications are dropped. Treat Sunsigns as attributes of the same level from the Convocational Sunsign Modifiers for magic invocations. Magic does not work along spell lines (q.v.). Each military occupation is treated as a separate occupation as well.

Available skills are according to the occupations listed above, determined by Harnworld professions. More skills may be created according to players' or GM's wishes. A selection of often used skills that do not easily relate to occupations is given below

Situations which require rolls are announced by the GM with a general description of what needs to be resolved. Players will then argue, which skills could be applicable and the GM will give a corresponding percentage of how much they apply.
For example, an assessemnt of the correct political relation between to rival noble families may be Herald/75% and Knight/50%, and Mercantyler/25%.

Now roll for all applicable skills you have a value in. (Remember that a base 0 always applies.) In the example above, the mercantyler has a 1 in 4 chance of using his mercantyler skill, say 12, and a 3 in 4 chance of using his knight skill 0. All skills which were succeessfully rolled for are added up through row 3 from the main rules additions table (repeated here). The end result is the skill to roll against.

The following skills can be used in addition to the occupation skills. They are considered standard. Sunsigns affect certain applications of skills. Since the "old" skills still remain in their descriptive sense, a player should announce, when he feels like his sunsign would apply to a situation. Sunsigns are attributes

ul.li: Intuition: This skill combines the "old" Awareness and Intrigue skills and means the ability to infer more than the senses obviously provide. This includes interpreting the twitching when someone lies as well as a piece of wood out of place.

div.p: Certain applications of skills are provided with result tables to allow comparisons.
